snippet: The Brooklyn director Nathan Silver has made lively attempts at capturing the flickering, uncertain energies among people in a room with his freely made yet nuanced movies.
abstract: Brooklyn director Nathan Silver continues to make lively attempts at capturing flickering, uncertain energies among people with his freely made yet nuanced films; his latest feature, Soft in the Head, is unpredictable tale of recently single Brooklyn woman who careens between home of Orthodox Jewish friend and halfway house for mentally unstable.
lead_paragraph: The Brooklyn director Nathan Silver has made lively attempts at capturing the flickering, uncertain energies among people in a room with his freely made yet nuanced movies.

headline.seo: Nathan Silver Gives His Actors Room to Improvise on the Set
headline.main: A Freewheeling Pursuit of Spontaneity on Film
headline.print_headline: A Freewheeling Pursuit of Spontaneity on Film
